definition: like a swarm of bees/everyone swarms around pushing and shouting/a hornet's nest
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
nest/pit or hollow on the human body/lair/den/place/to harbor or shelter/to hold in check/to bend/classifier for litters and broods

sentences.english: Farmers didn't have to scrambled to plant common vegetables this year.
sentences.chinese: 今年农民不再一窝蜂似的种大路菜了。

sentences.english: Uber-rich Mainland Chinese business owners have been flocking to Hong Kong, and it's not just because it's the world's business and trade center.
sentences.chinese: 中国内地的巨富们正在一窝蜂地拥向香港。

sentences.english: People rushed into the bus when it came.
sentences.chinese: 公共汽车到站时，人们都一窝蜂地往上挤。

sentences.english: When public figures die we mourn them en-masse.
sentences.chinese: 每当有公众人物去世，我们总是一窝蜂地进行哀悼。

sentences.english: They attacked the circus like a hive of bees and arrested all involved.
sentences.chinese: 于是一窝蜂似地突袭了马戏团，逮捕了所有涉案人员。

sentences.english: The ferrets rush wildly for the fireplace.
sentences.chinese: 小鼬子一窝蜂似地跑向壁炉。

definition: striving to be first and fearing to be last (idiom); outdoing one another
see 一哄而散[yi1 hong1 er2 san4]
noisy and in disarray/in an uproar
regardless of the consequences/recklessly relying on a hopelessly optimistic forecast
pinyin: bu4 guan3 san1 qi1 er4 shi2 yi1

definition: (of a group of people) to rush into action
to respond instantly/to act at once on hearing the news
lit. scatter like birds and beasts (idiom)/fig. to head off in various directions/to flee helter-skelter
to shout and quarrel/to make a big fuss
